meanings.definition: To engage in a prolonged and bitter quarrel or dispute.
meanings.sent1: The neighbors were feuding over the property line for months.
meanings.sent2: The two families have been feuding for generations.
meanings.sent3: The cats were feuding over the sunny spot near the window.
meanings.sent4: The political parties were feuding over the new legislation.
meanings.sent5: The siblings were feuding over who got to sit in the front seat of the car.

meanings.definition: A prolonged and bitter quarrel or dispute.
meanings.sent1: The feuding between the two groups caused a lot of tension in the community.
meanings.sent2: The feuding among the team members affected their performance.
meanings.sent3: The feuding over the last piece of cake was quite entertaining to watch.
meanings.sent4: The feuding in the courtroom resembled a scene from a dramatic movie.
meanings.sent5: The feuding between the siblings was a constant source of annoyance for their parents.
